pull.title: bip155: mark torv2 as no longer in use
pull.body: TorV2 is deprecated, implementations are removing any support for it and we could specify this deprecation here. Especially because implementations are no longer serializing/deserializing and relaying Tor v2 addresses, they're ignoring incoming Tor v2 addresses, etc.

labels.name: Pending acceptance
labels.description: This BIP modification requires sign-off by the champion of the BIP being modified

events.body:
Pinging BIP author @laanwj for feedback or approval.

Not sure if Appendix A about Tor v2 address encoding should be removed or kept for historical context.
Perhaps a Changelog would be useful here.

> Not sure if Appendix A about Tor v2 address encoding should be removed or kept for historical context.

Or maybe we could keep it for historical context but change the title to `Appendix A: Tor v2 address encoding (Deprecated)`.
Maybe `Appendix A: Tor v2 address encoding (for historical context, as Tor v2 is no longer operational)`

Thanks for the review, @laanwj.
@brunoerg: I think adding a Changelog section and moving the majority of the text into a footnote sounds good.

> Thanks for the review, @laanwj.
> @brunoerg: I think adding a Changelog section and moving the majority of the text into a footnote sounds good.

Agreed, will do it.

Just moved the text into a footnote (I just noted that some BIPs calls the section that refers to `<references/>` as `References` and some others as `Footnotes` - so I think I put it on the right place) and added a `Changelog`.

CI [failure](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/actions/runs/18171090099/job/51725721646?pr=1975) seems unrelated:
```
./typos
jq: jq-1.7
$ ./typos .
Warning: "Falke" should be "False".
error: `Falke` should be `False`
     ./bip-0099.mediawiki:355:62
    
355  Btcdrak, Gavin Andresen, Gregory Sanders, Luke Dashjr, Marco Falke.
```
@brunoerg CI issue is indeed unrelated, fixed in #1996

rename.to: bip155: mark torv2 as no longer in use

events.message: bip155: torv2 is no longer operational

verification.payload:
tree f13157949e1ce2fdf83443a1df5c0c10d79ffbc9
parent 0035953ca20559964a5d0f66ded489c91b25957a
author Mark "Murch" Erhardt <murch@murch.one> 1759453324 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1759453324 -0700

bip155: drop space before reference

comments.diff_hunk: @@ -101,7 +101,7 @@ The list of reserved network IDs is as follows: | 0x03 | TORV2 | 10 -| Tor v2 hidden service address +| Tor v2 hidden service address (**Deprecated**; clients **MUST NOT** gossip or relay Tor v2 addresses and **MUST** ignore them on receive).
comments.body:
Concept ACK. Didn't verify, but as I recall Tor v2 was not only deprecated, but no longer supported. Is it still operational?

```suggestion
| Tor v2 hidden service address (**Tor v2 is no longer operational**; clients **MUST NOT** gossip or relay Tor v2 addresses and **MUST** ignore them on receive).
```

comments.diff_hunk: @@ -101,7 +101,7 @@ The list of reserved network IDs is as follows: | 0x03 | TORV2 | 10 -| Tor v2 hidden service address +| Tor v2 hidden service address (**Deprecated**; clients **MUST NOT** gossip or relay Tor v2 addresses and **MUST** ignore them on receive).
comments.body: You're right, just changed to it to say "no longer operational".

comments.diff_hunk: @@ -101,7 +101,7 @@ The list of reserved network IDs is as follows: | 0x03 | TORV2 | 10 -| Tor v2 hidden service address +| Tor v2 hidden service address (**Deprecated**; clients **MUST NOT** gossip or relay Tor v2 addresses and **MUST** ignore them on receive).
comments.body: Yes, verified that the Tor software no longer supports v2 since July 2021 and the code was removed from the codebase.

comments.diff_hunk: @@ -101,7 +101,7 @@ The list of reserved network IDs is as follows: | 0x03 | TORV2 | 10 -| Tor v2 hidden service address +| Tor v2 hidden service address (**Tor v2 is no longer operational**; clients **MUST NOT** gossip or relay Tor v2 addresses and **MUST** ignore them on receive).
comments.body:
It doesn't look like `**` works (the idea was to make bold text, i guess?) in the rendered version. https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/278aa42bdca2824d0e42fbfa4a7167955b08aaf1/bip-0155.mediawiki

Also i wonder if this wouldn't better be moved to a footnote, instead of having the entire text in the table

E.g. Tor v2 hidden service address (no longer used [1]) 

[1] *Tor v2 is no longer operational*; clients *MUST NOT* gossip or relay Tor v2 addresses and *MUST* ignore them on receive

comments.diff_hunk: @@ -101,7 +101,7 @@ The list of reserved network IDs is as follows: | 0x03 | TORV2 | 10 -| Tor v2 hidden service address +| Tor v2 hidden service address (**Tor v2 is no longer operational**; clients **MUST NOT** gossip or relay Tor v2 addresses and **MUST** ignore them on receive).
comments.body: The MediaWiki format uses single quotes to format text as follows: ```''italic''```, ```'''bold'''```, ```'''''bold & italic'''''```.

comments.diff_hunk: @@ -101,7 +101,7 @@ The list of reserved network IDs is as follows: | 0x03 | TORV2 | 10 -| Tor v2 hidden service address +| Tor v2 hidden service address (**Tor v2 is no longer operational**; clients **MUST NOT** gossip or relay Tor v2 addresses and **MUST** ignore them on receive).

@@ -101,7 +101,7 @@ The list of reserved network IDs is as follows: | 0x03 | TORV2 | 10 -| Tor v2 hidden service address +| Tor v2 hidden service address (no longer usedTor v2 is no longer operational; clients MUST NOT gossip or relay Tor v2 addresses and MUST ignore them on receive)
comments.body:
Agree that this information was too long for the table and is better as a footnote.

Should Appendix A also be updated with that info? Seems odd to leave it as-is and have it be contradicted elsewhere in a footnote. What do you think?

comments.diff_hunk: @@ -101,7 +101,7 @@ The list of reserved network IDs is as follows: | 0x03 | TORV2 | 10 -| Tor v2 hidden service address +| Tor v2 hidden service address (no longer usedTor v2 is no longer operational; clients MUST NOT gossip or relay Tor v2 addresses and MUST ignore them on receive)
comments.body: I agree it's odd to leave the Appendix A as is. We could point out there to the same `<ref>` we introduced before.

comments.diff_hunk: @@ -101,7 +101,7 @@ The list of reserved network IDs is as follows: | 0x03 | TORV2 | 10 -| Tor v2 hidden service address +| Tor v2 hidden service address (no longer usedTor v2 is no longer operational; clients MUST NOT gossip or relay Tor v2 addresses and MUST ignore them on receive)

@@ -152,7 +152,7 @@ The reference implementation is available at (to be done)
 
 - Gregory Maxwell: various suggestions regarding extensibility
 
-==Appendix A: Tor v2 address encoding==
+==Appendix A: Tor v2 address encoding (no longer used <ref name="torv2" />)==
comments.body:
Nit: the space here should be dropped.

```suggestion
==Appendix A: Tor v2 address encoding (no longer used<ref name="torv2" />)==
```

comments.diff_hunk: @@ -193,6 +193,13 @@ Cjdns addresses are simply IPv6 addresses in the fc00::/8 range0200::/7 range[https://yggdrasil-network.github.io/faq.html#will-yggdrasil-conflict-with-my-network-routing Yggdrasil FAQ]. They MUST be sent with the YGGDRASIL network ID. +== Changelog == + +* 0.2.0 (2025-10-01): +** Add note that Tor v2 is no longer operational. +* 0.1.0 (2019-02-27): +** Initial version
comments.body: Actually, per BIP3 which specifies the Changelog section, the initial version should be 1.0.0. And this may well be considered a breaking change of the specification?
